Hi all... i am 1 meter close to frobo orbiting around kerbin just with his eva suit how to rescue him? I have an unmanned spacecraft with the single seat pod ready to bring him back to Kerbin... How?

P.S. can't switch to use him from the map view o from the control center

thank you very much

byebye

Edited September 15, 2014 by Paolino

You have to switch to him in normal view by pressing "[" or "]"

Then you'll be able to control him like normal, fly him to the pod via his jetpack.

There are so many threads because the problem (yes, it's a problem) is that it is utterly non-intuitive. If you check in the tracking station, it explicitly informs you you cannot take control of him because you do not "own" him. There is then little reason to consider switching vessels to him (aside from the fact he's not a vessel) when you know this. I assumed that I had to get extra close to him, for example, then something would just happen, or I could right click on him, etc, etc, so I maneuvered within a few meters of him (which itself was non-trivial as a noob with no RCS), before exiting and looking here for a solution.

When you first start playing, it's not the least bit clear. By the time you are getting rescue missions as a new player, you don't yet even have docking ports, typically, so you in fact have zero reason to need to know how to switch between ships. You also might presume (because it's entirely logical to do so), that you cannot switch between something you own, and something you don't. I tried selecting in map view (works for every other ship/kerbal I want to focus on), that didn't work. I tried the tracking station (also works in every single other case), that didn't work. That it only works for a key shortcut (with no explanation) is absurd.

These posts will be completely common as long as the UI in this case makes no sense to new players. If people ask how to do things that should be obvious, it's bad UI design, period.

This question is also in the FAQ stickied in this forum.

However, there is no need to yell at people for posting a question. That is, after all, a big part of why the forums exist.

The game needs some work, pure and simple. If you have a good idea, post it in the suggestions forum.

Cheers, and happy kerbaling.

-Claw

Edited September 27, 2014 by emerson

emerson, are you by any chance playing on a non-US keyboard? I recall some German players saying that the default key bindings to switch ships was different for them.

If you go to the settings screen and navigate to the Input tab, Misc. subtab, you should see the bindings as follows:

You can see what keys are bound to 'Focus Next Vessel', and 'Focus Prev Vessel', or bind new ones (or secondary ones) if you like.

If this still doesn't work, then you either have a mod incompatibility issue or you've found a bug which you might like to report on the bugs forum.

Also double check that you're not in time warp. If you're in even 5x time warp it won't let you switch away, I don't think.
